page.title: 06FARMING AROUND BRABOURNE
page.content: From a distance,the slopes of the North Downs may appear to be dotted with white.A closer look may reveal the white dots to be moving.They are of course sheep.Here on the steep slopes,it is not possible to cultivate the land using machinery. On the less steep slopes the sheep have had to give way to more intensive farming,fields of barley having taken their place. Although some sheep are to be found in fields below the slopes of the downs,it is more likely that there will be barley,wheat,peas,or oil-seed rape.From the top of the downs the spring-time view is interrupted by the bright yellow of the blooming oil-seed rape. Some cattle are kept,and for these are fields of grass to be cut for use as silage in the winter.
